title: Project 3
text:
library(openintro)

Loading required package: airports


Loading required package: cherryblossom


Loading required package: usdata

library(ggplot2)

Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.2.2

library(purrr)
library(dplyr)


Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

data("present")
head(present)

# A tibble: 6 × 3
   year    boys   girls
  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>
1  1940 1211684 1148715
2  1941 1289734 1223693
3  1942 1444365 1364631
4  1943 1508959 1427901
5  1944 1435301 1359499
6  1945 1404587 1330869



Is there a statistically significant difference in the number of boys and girls born in the U.S. each year from 1940 to 2002?
-Null Hypothesis (H0): There is no difference in the mean number of boys and girls born each year. -Alternative hypothesis(H1): There is a difference in the mean number of boys and girls born each year.
Permutation Test


Shuffle the gender labels each year to simulate the null distribution of birth counts under the assumption of no difference between boys and girls. -Calculate the observed difference in mean birth counts -Compare the observed difference to the distribution of permuted differences to estimate a p-value.


observed_diff <- mean(present$boys) - mean(present$girls)

perm_test <- function(data) {
  combined <- c(data$boys, data$girls)
  shuffled <- sample(combined)
  boys_sample <- shuffled[1:length(data$boys)]
  girls_sample <- shuffled[(length(data$boys) + 1):length(combined)]
  mean(boys_sample) - mean(girls_sample)
}


set.seed(123)
perm_diffs <- map_dbl(1:1000, ~ perm_test(present))


ggplot(data.frame(perm_diffs), aes(x = perm_diffs)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "blue", color = "black") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = observed_diff, color = "red") +
  labs(
    title = "Permutation Test for Difference in Birth Counts",
    x = "Difference in Means (Boys - Girls)", y = "Frequency"
  ) +
  annotate("text", x = observed_diff, y = max(table(cut(perm_diffs, 30))) / 2,
           label = "Observed Difference", color = "red")







p_value <- mean(perm_diffs >= observed_diff)
p_value

[1] 0.011


The histogram represents the distribution of differences in means (boys - girls) under the null hypothesis, where the gender labels were randomly shuffled. The distribution is approximately centered around zero, which is expected if there is no real difference between the two groups (boys and girls).
The red line which is located in the far right indicates the observed difference in means between boys and girls in the actual data.
Since the observed difference is in the far-right tail of the null distribution, it means that this difference is unlikely to occur by random chance. This is further supported by the size of the p-value which is 0.011. This is less than 0.05 so we reject the null hypothesis.
Source of Data: https://github.com/OpenIntroStat/openintro/blob/HEAD/R/data-present.R Co-authored-by: Mine Cetinkaya-Rundel cetinkaya.mine@gmail.com

title: Premier League Match Analysis
text:
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(ggplot2)
tuesdata <- tt_load('2023-04-04')

---- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2023-04-04 ----
--- There is 1 file available ---


── Downloading files ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  1 of 1: "soccer21-22.csv"

soccer <- tuesdata$soccer
colnames(soccer)

 [1] "Date"     "HomeTeam" "AwayTeam" "FTHG"     "FTAG"     "FTR"     
 [7] "HTHG"     "HTAG"     "HTR"      "Referee"  "HS"       "AS"      
[13] "HST"      "AST"      "HF"       "AF"       "HC"       "AC"      
[19] "HY"       "AY"       "HR"       "AR"      

ggplot(soccer,aes(x=HS, y=FTHG))+
 geom_point()+
 labs(title = "Relationship Between Shots taken and Goals Scored By Home Teams",
      x= "Number of shots", y= "Number of goals")







#source of data: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2023/2023-04-04/readme.md and https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/evangower/premier-league-match-data

title: SAFI Data Survey Analysis
text:
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(ggplot2)
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2023-06-13')

---- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2023-06-13 ----
--- There is 1 file available ---


── Downloading files ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  1 of 1: "safi_data.csv"

safi_data <- tuesdata$`safi_data`

ggplot(safi_data,aes(x=years_liv, y=liv_count))+
 geom_point()+
 labs(title = "Relationship Between Years Living In Village and Livestock Count",
      x="Number of years", y= "Number of livestock")







#source of data:https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2023/2023-06-13/readme.md  and https://datacarpentry.org/socialsci-workshop/data/
